entries.title: Labor Department Issues Citations Against Amazon Over Warehouse Injuries
entries.description: OSHA conducted workplace safety inspections at six Amazon facilities.

entries.title: Apple Explores Allowing iPhone, iPad Users to Download Apps Outside Its Store
entries.description: The company is looking at how to limit the security and business impact from allowing the so-called sideloading of apps, according to people familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Why Is This Little Waffle Maker Such a Big Holiday Gift?
entries.description: Breakfast fans are collecting Dash Mini Waffle Makers and showing off their favorites—and unique waffle creations—across social media.

entries.title: Advent to Buy Maxar Technologies for About $4 Billion
entries.description: Advent International agreed to buy Maxar Technologies in a deal that values the satellite owner and operator at about $4 billion.

entries.title: TikTok's Efforts to Distance Itself From Chinese Parent Stumble Over Talent
entries.description: The short-video app is making big efforts to reduce ties with Beijing-based ByteDance, but it is still hiring staff in China for key functions.

entries.title: Twitter Suspends Accounts of Several Journalists
entries.description: The social-media platform also blocked the official account of rival platform Mastodon, the latest instance of it making content or user decisions under Elon Musk without much transparency.

entries.title: What Will Wearables, Bikes and Coffee Gear Look Like in 2023?
entries.description: We polled six tech experts on the trends they’re excited for (and dreading)

entries.title: When Will Fusion Be Ready? Watch These Numbers
entries.description: The latest fusion experiment cleared the first hurdle, but there are two more before it starts delivering clean, affordable energy
